description: From Old French pervertir, itself from the Latin pervert≈ç.

entries.meaning: (dated) One who has been perverted; one who has turned to error; one who has turned to a twisted sense of values or morals.
A person whose sexual habits are not considered acceptable.

verbs.description: pervert (third-person singular simple present perverts, present participle perverting, simple past and past participle perverted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To turn another way; to divert.
(transitive) To corrupt; to cause to be untrue; corrupted or otherwise impure
examples: How could stopping someone from killing himself or herself "pervert the course of justice"?

entries.meaning: To misapply, misuse, use for a nefarious purpose
examples: He has perverted his talents to dishonest gain.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To become perverted; to take the wrong course.
examples: After that worde, "better is it to dey than lyve false," and al wolde perverted people false reporte make
